greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Maximum run-length of the nontrivial divisors (greater than 1 and less than n) of n.
comment: By convention, a(1) = 1, and a(p) = 0 for p prime.
example: The non-singleton runs of the nontrivial divisors of 1260 are: {2,3,4,5,6,7} {9,10} {14,15} {20,21} {35,36}, so a(1260) = 6.
xref: Positions of first appearances are A328459.
The version that looks at all divisors is A055874.
The number of successive pairs of divisors > 1 of n is A088722(n).
The Heinz number of the multiset of run-lengths of divisors of n is A328166(n).
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Oct 17 2019
